articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israel's plan to expand its Gaza offensive, displace people within the enclave and take control of aid distribution has horrified Gazans who have already suffered multiple displacements and food shortages during 19 months of conflict.
articles.title: 'What's left to bomb?' Israel's plan to expand campaign strikes fear into Gazans

articles.author: Joshua McElwee, Crispian Balmer
articles.description: Cardinals who will take part in the secret conclave to elect a new pope began checking into two Vatican hotels.
articles.title: Cardinals enter seclusion ahead of secret conclave to elect new pope

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Multiple explosions and fires were seen and heard in Sudan's capital Port Sudan early on Tuesday, a witness said, though the exact locations and causes were unclear, as a civil war rocks the previously quiet city for the third day.
articles.title: Explosions heard in Sudanese city of Port Sudan, witness says

articles.author: Shivangi Acharya, Alistair Smout
articles.description: India and the United Kingdom concluded on Tuesday a long-coveted free trade pact, in a landmark deal that represents London's most significant post-Brexit agreement that was finalised in the shadow of U.S. President Donald Trump's tariff increases.
articles.title: Britain and India clinch landmark trade deal in shadow of Trump's tariffs

articles.author: Mohammed Ghobari
articles.description: The Israeli military said it fired on Yemen's main airport on Tuesday and witnesses said there were four strikes in the capital Sanaa, the latest hostilities as tensions rise between Israel and Yemen's Iran-aligned Houthi rebels.
articles.title: Israel says it struck Yemen's main airport in Sanaa

articles.author: Steve Holland, Jarrett Renshaw, Doina Chiacu
articles.description: President Donald Trump announced on Tuesday the U.S. will stop bombing the Houthis in Yemen, saying that the Iran-aligned group had agreed to stop interrupting important shipping lanes in the Middle East.
articles.title: Trump says US will stop bombing Houthis after agreement struck

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Almost half of Gazans may be willing to apply to Israel to help them leave to other countries, according to a survey on Tuesday that also showed significant support for anti-Hamas protests.
articles.title: Almost half of Gazans willing to leave, survey finds

articles.author: Erin Banco, Phil Stewart, Gram Slattery, Mike Stone
articles.description: Roughly a week after Donald Trump started his second term as president, the U.S. military issued an order to three freight airlines operating out of Dover Air Force Base in Delaware and a U.S. base in the United Arab Emirates: Stop 11 flights loaded with artillery shells and other weaponry and bound for Ukraine.
articles.title: Exclusive: Order by Hegseth to cancel Ukraine weapons caught White House off guard

articles.author: Gibran Peshimam, Shivam Patel
articles.description: Seven Pakistan army soldiers were killed on Tuesday when their vehicle was targeted by an improvised explosive device, Pakistan's military said, blaming arch rival India for the attack.
articles.title: Pakistan blames India for vehicle blast that kills seven soldiers

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian air defence forces repelled attacks by 13 Ukrainian drones in the Moscow region and in two other regions, Kaluga and Tula, south of the Russian capital, the defence ministry said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Russia downs 13 Ukrainian drones near Moscow region, defence ministry says
